subject: Self Care
title: How Much Sleep You Really Need
description: A 60-second lesson on How Much Sleep You Really Need.

hook.text: Some CEOs brag about sleeping four hours. Science says they're slowly destroying their own brains.

buildup.text: Adults need seven to nine hours. Teens need eight to ten. Newborns sleep up to seventeen hours.

discovery.text: The rare gene DEC2 lets some people thrive on six hours. Less than 1% of people carry it.

twist.text: Most people who claim they need less sleep have simply forgotten what fully rested feels like.

climax.text: Chronic under-sleeping shrinks the brain, weakens immunity, and raises the risk of dementia.

punchline.text: You probably need more sleep than you think.

quiz.question: What percentage of people carry the DEC2 short-sleep gene?
